title: Cal Cunningham
added: In July 2020, Cunningham's Republican opponent [[Thom Tillis]] claimed Cunningham had been "silent" on the issue of [[Defund the Police|defunding the police]], saying "I assume his silence is consent". In fact, Cunningham had published an [[op-ed]] 9 days earlier stating his opposition to defunding the police and advocating [[police reform]], including policies that "counsel [[de-escalation]], prohibit [[chokehold]]s, limit [[no-knock warrant]]s, and specifically address the use of [[deadly force]]".<ref>{{cite web |last1=Specht |first1=Paul |title=No, Cunningham has not been 'silent' on defunding police |url=https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/aug/19/thom-tillis/no-cunningham-has-not-been-silent-defunding-police/ |website=[[PolitiFact]] |date=August 19, 2020}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last1=Cunningham |first1=Cal |title=Priorities for Constructive Change in Policing |url=https://medium.com/cal-for-nc/priorities-for-constructive-change-in-policing-bf7bc25b65b9 |website=[[Medium (website)|Medium]] |language=en |date=11 June 2020}}</ref>

title: Cal Cunningham
added: Cunningham married Elizabeth Kolb in 2000 and have two children.<ref>https://heavy.com/news/elizabeth-kolb-cal-cunningham-wife/</ref>

title: Cal Cunningham
deleted: Cal Cunningham is married with two children.<ref>https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/us-politics/cal-cunningham-admits-sending-sexual-texts-strategist-cal-cunningham-wife-thom-tillis-support-ap-b755718.html?amp</ref><ref>https://justfacts.votesmart.org/candidate/biography/40999/cal-cunningham</ref><ref>https://www.calfornc.com/meet-cal/</ref><ref>https://amp.newsobserver.com/news/politics-government/article246191610.html</ref><ref>https://apnews.com/article/senate-elections-north-carolina-archive-cal-cunningham-dea469d30c56cfada78244a8af6065b3</ref> In October 2020 it was reported that Cunningham had sent sexually explicit text messages to California public relations strategist Arlene Guzman Todd.<ref>https://www.dailywire.com/news/democrat-senate-candidate-sent-sexual-texts-to-woman-who-isnt-his-wife</ref><ref>https://www.usnews.com/news/best-states/north-carolina/articles/2020-10-03/cal-cunningham-admits-to-sending-sexual-texts-to-strategist</ref><ref>https://www.newsobserver.com/news/politics-government/article246191610.html</ref><ref>https://www.fox13memphis.com/news/politics/cal-cunningham/POAWWGHQDM6AYUXRJAT7VWN2NA/</ref><ref>https://www.wral.com/cal-cunningham-admits-to-sexual-messages-with-calif-woman-will-stay-in-senate-race/19318069/</ref><ref>https://www.wsoctv.com/news/local/cal-cunningham-admits-sending-sexts-woman-who-is-not-his-wife/XU32Q6F735CYFGRAJ5GJXVEDIU/</ref> Cunningham has admitted and apologised for sending the messages.

title: Cal Cunningham

title: Cal Cunningham
added: Cunningham is a [[Presbyterian_polity#Elder|ordained elder]] in the [[Presbyterianism|Presbyterian Church]].<ref>Brian Murphy, [https://www.newsobserver.com/news/politics-government/election/article246090170.html Cunningham says Supreme Court vacancy should wait, but he’d meet with Amy Coney Barrett], ''News & Observer'' (September 29, 2020).</ref>

title: Cal Cunningham
deleted: In 2009, he was awarded the [[Bronze Star Medal]] and the General Douglas MacArthur Award for Leadership for his service in [[Iraq]].<ref name=Award/><ref name=":0"/><ref>{{cite web |title=Kilpatrick Stockton's Cal Cunningham Receives Gen. Douglas MacArthur Leadership Award at Pentagon Ceremony |url=https://www.kilpatricktownsend.com/~/media/Files/newsreleases/KilpatrickStocktonsCalCunninghamReceivesGenDouglasMacArthurLeadershipAwardatPentagonCeremony.ashx <!-- http://www.kilpatricktownsend.com/~/media/Files/newsreleases/awardsandaccolades%20_3_.ashx --> |website=Kilpatrick Townsend & Stockton LLP |accessdate=30 September 2020}}</ref>

title: Cal Cunningham
added: On October 3, 2020, the ''New York Times'' wrote that in a period of several hours, North Carolina's U.S. Senate race had fallen into "utter mayhem" and was "engulfed in chaos" after Cunningham admitted to sending romantic texts messages to a woman who is not his wife and it was announced that Tillis had tested positive for the coronavirus. The ''Times'' wrote that Cunningham's texting scandal was "a blow to a carefully cultivated personal image" as

"Cunningham has leaned heavily on his character and biography, playing up his military service and presenting himself as an inoffensive moderate." Meanwhile, Tillis' diagnosis called into question whether he would be able to participate in the confirmation hearings of U.S. Supreme Court nominee [[Amy Coney Barrett]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Edmondson |first1=Catie |title=Virus Diagnosis and Secret Texts Upend a Critical Senate Race in a Single Night |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2020/10/03/us/politics/coronavirus-thom-tillis-cal-cunningham-north-carolina.html |accessdate=4 October 2020 |work=The New York Times |date=3 October 2020}}</ref>

title: Cal Cunningham
deleted: In October 2020, Cunningham attracted controversy when it was revealed that he had exchanged romantic text messages with a woman who was not his wife.

title: Cal Cunningham
deleted: When asked by reporters whether there were any other women with whom he'd had an affair Cunningham refused to answer. Several days later it was learned he'd been romantically involved in a years long affair with a female attorney.

title: Cal Cunningham
deleted: In 2008, Cunningham received a Pro Bono Impact Award and recognition from Legal Aid of [[Forsyth County, North Carolina|Forsyth County]] for legal representation of victims of domestic violence and of tenants in disputes with their landlords.<ref>{{cite web|date=June 2008|title=LANC News:The Newsletter of Legal Aid of North Carolina, Inc. LANC-Winston-Salem Office Special Edition|url=https://www.legalaidnc.org/sites/default/files/2020-08/LegalAidNews_Winston-Salem_June_08_.pdf|accessdate=August 11, 2020|publisher=Legal Aid of North Carolina|page=4}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Kilpatrick Stockton’s Winston-Salem Office Receives Prestigious Awards from Business Leader Magazine |url=http://www.kilpatricktownsend.com/~/media/Files/newsreleases/KilpatrickStocktonsWinstonSalemOfficeReceivesPrestigiousAwardsfromBusinessLeaderMagazine.ashx |quote=Attorneys Cal Cunningham, Elliot Fus, and Rich Keshian received 2008 Impact Pro Bono Awards for making an impact through their pro bono service in North Carolina. |website=Kilpatrick Townsend & Stockton LLP |date= 16 January 2009  |accessdate=30 September 2020}}</ref>
